example.eg: The term 'basket case' has an interesting origin.
There is a thirty-day term for making payments.
She enrolled in five classes for the spring term.
example.egtrans: 她为春季学期注册了五门课。

example.eg: The thief was sentenced to a four-year term of imprisonment.
example.egtrans: 那个小偷被判了四年刑期的监禁。

example.eg: The president serves a four-year term.
I heard that they are not dating any more.  Are they still on friendly terms?
example.egtrans: 我听说他们没有再约会了。那他们关系还友好么？

example.eg: The two sides came to terms, and signed the contract.
example.egtrans: 双方就条款达成了一致，签署了协议。

example.eg: What are your terms for performing the operation privately, doctor?
example.egtrans: 医生，你私人手术的费用是多少？

example.eg: It all depends on the terms of the contract.  Is there a warranty?
example.egtrans: 那完全取决于合同条款。有写着保修么？

example.eg: She carried the baby to term, and it was born healthy.
example.egtrans: 她怀孕至足月分娩，产下的宝宝很健康。

dsense.name: term
dsense.guideword: (mathematics: part of an equation) (数学术语)

example.eg: The first term is unknown and denoted by an 'x'.
example.egtrans: 第一个项是未知项，用“x”表示。

dsense.name: term
dsense.guideword: (mathematics: part of a series) (数学术语)

example.eg: The first four terms of this geometric series are 1, 2, 4, 8.
example.egtrans: 这个等比数列的前四个项是：1、2、4、8。

example.eg: It all depends on how you want to term it; is it cheap or is it inexpensive?

trans_examp.trans_cn: 普通用语, 通俗说法

dsense.name: fixed-term
dsense.guideword: (lasting for a specified period of time)

example.eg: In the United States the President serves a four-year term.
John F. Kennedy was not a full-term president as he was assassinated after less than three years in office.
We're planning to spend a few days in Wales during half term.

dsense.name: in the long term, in the long-term

example.eg: The investment in new machinery will cost a lot of money, but will be worthwhile in the long term.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 从长远来看，就长期而言

dsense.name: in the short term
dsense.guideword: (temporarily, for a brief time in the future)

example.eg: How can we help the long-term unemployed back into work?
example.egtrans: 我们该如何帮助长期失业者重返工作岗位？

dsense.name: long-term effect
dsense.guideword: often plural (impact extending into the future)

example.eg: My long-term memory is fine, but I have no idea what I did this morning.
These bonds are medium term and have an average maturity of 4.5 years.
The results of the mid-term vote surprised everyone.
The children are all ready for the new school term.
She's serving a six-month prison term for assaulting her landlord.
The judge sentenced him to a long prison term.
Children can start school at the beginning of the school term following their fifth birthday.
Board members are elected for a set term of two years.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 设定好的条件, 既定条件

example.eg: We weren't in a position to set terms so had to go along with what they decided.
My short-term educational goal is to graduate college.
example.egtrans: 我短期的学业目标是从大学毕业。

dsense.name: short-term memory
dsense.guideword: (capacity for recall over a brief period)

example.eg: His short-term memory began to fail when he reached 80 years of age.
The technical term for bad breath is halitosis.
"Sweetie", "sugar" and "honey" are terms of endearment.
The mayor's term of office is coming to an end.
My term paper for history class is due on Monday.

dsense.name: term time, term-time
dsense.guideword: UK (months when classes are in session)
